utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, boy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t comment without violating our agreement that I don’t criticize your work.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then what was oh, boy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great restraint on my part.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s nothing wrong with the science here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps you mean a different thing than I do when you say science.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (making a change)
utterance.content: Okay, how’s that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You actually had it right in the first place. Once again, you’ve fallen for one of my classic pranks. Bazinga! Well, now here’s a peculiar e-mail. The president of the university wants me to meet him at his office tomorrow morning at 8 a.m.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It doesn’t say. It must be an emergency. Everyone at the university knows I eat breakfast at eight and move my bowels at 8:20.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, how did we live before Twitter? I guess you’ll find out what it is in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s 14 hours away. For the next 840 minutes, I’m effectively one of Heisenberg’s particles, I know where I am or I know how fast I’m going, but I can’t know both. Yet how am I supposed to carry on with this huge annoying thing hovering over my head?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I know the feeling.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard. Leonard. Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s two o’clock in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why is everybody keep telling me what time it is?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Everybody?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You, the president of the university, his wife, their sullen teenage daughter. That entire family is fascinated by what time it is and whether people know it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You went to President Seibert’s house in the middle of the night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He didn’t respond to my e-mail, his phone number is unlisted. Tell me what my other option was.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You could have waited until morning. I know, look who I’m talking to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you remember the grant proposal I submitted to the National Science Foundation to detect slow-moving monopoles at the magnetic North Pole?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hardly a day goes by when I don’t think about it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aw, how nice. Well, a space opened up at the last minute on the NSF expedition to the Arctic Circle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait a minute. He offered to send you to the North Pole?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. In fact, he was quite enthusiastic. He said, “Frankly, if I could send you tonight, I would.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, well, do you want to go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course not. I’m a theoretical physicist, a career I chose in no small part because it’s indoors, but if I’m able to detect slow-moving magnetic monopoles there, I will be the scientist to confirm string theory. People will write books about me. Third-graders will create macaroni-art dioramas depicting scenes from my life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, maybe a tableau of me trying to pummel you to death.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sarcasm?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m on the horns of a dilemma. Can you imagine me, Sheldon Cooper, at the North Pole?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Easy peasy, I’m doing it right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not good with cold, Leonard. How often have we had to leave a movie theatre because I got a headache from drinking the Icee too fast? I can’t go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, then don’t go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you say that? The scientific opportunity of a lifetime presents itself and my best friend says don’t go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, then go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Listen to you. How can I possibly go?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, what are the words I can say right now to end this conversation and let me go back to sleep?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Odd, President Seibert posed the exact same question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How was it resolved?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It wasn’t. His wife set their dogs on me and rendered the question moot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just imagine. If he says yes, we’ll have an entire summer without Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We could play outside.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We could sit on the left side of the couch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I could use the bathroom at 8:20.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Our dreams are very small, aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good news, gentlemen, I have tentatively accepted…

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! Woo-hoo!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: …the invitation to join the Arctic Expedition.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not gonna be the same without you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Godspeed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, but your sentiments may be premature.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, I don’t like where this is going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would like to propose that the three of you accompany me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: To the North Pole?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is this just so we won’t touch your stuff while you’re away?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll admit that was a concern. But the fact is, I’ll need a support team. And the three of you are my first choice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, there are others who might be more qualified, but the thought of interviewing them gave me a stomach ache. Now, I know I’m proposing an enormous undertaking, so why don’t you take a few moments to discuss it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not really gonna go to the North Pole with him, are we?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: I’m still within earshot! You may want to wait for my door to close.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not really gonna go to the North Pole with him, are we?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. Let’s talk about it. This is a National Science Foundation expedition. I don’t know how we can turn it down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Easy. Instead of saying, no, we don’t want to go on an NSF expedition, say, no, we don’t want to spend “three months stuck in a cabin in the Arctic Circle with an anal nutbag.”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But if we were part of the team that confirmed string theory, we could drink for free in any bar in any college town with a university that has a strong science program.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, this is big science. You could be the engineer who builds the equipment that puts us on the cover of magazines.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I could also be the engineer who builds the crossbow that kills Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You still might get on a magazine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you guys are seriously considering this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And you think you can put up with Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I’m a Hindu. My religion teaches that if we suffer in this life we are rewarded in the next. Three months at the North Pole with Sheldon and I’m reborn as a well-hung billionaire with wings!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, gentlemen, have you reached a decision?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, damn it. Peer pressure. Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent. And just an FYI, as I am the expedition’s team leader, protocol dictates that be phrased fine, sir. But don’t worry, there will be a briefing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I need access to the Cheesecake Factory’s walk-in freezer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Now, honey, I already told you, the hamburger meat is fresh and stored at a safe temperature.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. This is to train for a three-month expedition to the magnetic North Pole.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know how that sentence could possibly confuse you, but to elaborate, I’m going to the Arctic Circle with Leonard, Wolowitz and Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re all going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: For three months?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that a yes or a no on the freezer? The woman has the attention span of a gnat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon says you’re going to the North Pole.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Pretty cool, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m just a little surprised you didn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, well, it all happened kind of fast, and we had to get physicals and buy thermal underwear and study up on, you know, snow and stuff. Sorry, I was gonna tell you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey, no, you don’t have to apologize. There’s no reason you have to tell me. I was just, you know, surprised.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, yes, you were busy, you were surprised, all very fascinating. Now where do we stand on the freezer?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is he serious?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, it would help.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, I’ll see what I can do. So, three months at the North Pole. Wow, that is awesome.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but at what point do you put this see what you can do plan into action?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just a warning, Sheldon, the freezer locks from the outside.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did she seem upset to you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Did she seem upset to you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, I got it right. Are you upset?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A little bit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Two for two. I’m on fire.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I mean, I know she’s not my girlfriend or anything, but wouldn’t you think she’d feel a little bad that I’m going to be gone for the whole summer?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That feels like a bonus question. I’m going to stop here while I’m ahead, but I’ve had a great time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright, now the purpose of this drill is to acclimate us to the use of tools in extreme temperatures such as we will face in the Arctic Circle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Where are your tools?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (pointing at his brain)
utterance.content: Right here. All right, team, open up your practice kits. As the university did not permit me to bring the actual equipment we’ll be using to the Cheesecake Factory, because apparently I’m “ridiculous,” I’ve provided substitutes which will exercise your fine motor skills. Leonard, you will be doing a series of complex mathematical problems on a vintage Casio model 1175 calculator watch I received when I won the Earth Science medal in 3rd grade. Treat it with respect. Raj, you will be painting sideburns and a Van Dyke on a six-inch figurine of Legolas the elf. Now, remember, a Van Dyke is a goatee without a moustache. Wolowitz, you will be completing a series of delicate surgical procedures on the classic children’s game, Operation. To begin with, you will remove funny bone for two hundred dollars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: For this I went to MIT.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And begin.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think I swallowed some paint!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t press any of the buttons with my gloves. Oh, son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Adversity is to be expected. Continue.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, boy, am I gonna get sued.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I can’t do this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, use your imagination. Innovate. Did Han Solo let Luke Skywalker freeze to death on the ice planet of Hoth? No. He cut open a tauntaun and used its internal body heat to warm him up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You heard the man. Hold him down and I’ll cut him open.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on, I know I don’t possess the tools of leadership, but I don’t understand why we can’t assemble the equipment inside the hut and then take it outside.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hadn’t thought of that. I guess we’re done here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Here, drink slash eat this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s hot chocolate with a stick of butter.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because in the frigid temperatures in the Arctic, we need to consume at least 5,000 calories a day just to maintain our body weight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you know I can’t eat butter. I’m lactose intolerant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Way ahead of you, that’s an “I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter” stick.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on his webcam)
utterance.content: But mummy, all the other guys are going to the North Pole.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: I don’t care what the other guys are doing. If the other guys jumped in the Bay of Bengal and tried to swim to Sri Lanka, would you follow them?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you were standing behind me nagging, I might.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Don’t talk back to your mother. This trip is much too dangerous, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s not. Howard, tell them.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Doctor and Mrs. Koothrappali, namaste. I understand your concern, but if it’ll make you feel any better, my mother is fine with me going, and this is a woman who kept a safety rail on my bed until I was 17.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: So, she has no problem with her son being eaten by a walrus?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s very unlikely, Mrs. Koothrappali. If Raj dies, it’ll be from frostbite, gangrene, acute sunburn or being ripped to shreds by a fifteen hundred pound polar bear.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma, I’m putting you on speakerphone with Raj’s parents. Can you tell them that you’re okay with me going to the Arctic?

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: Arctic? I thought you said Arkansas!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t say that. You never listen to me!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: He doesn’t tell me anything! He lives a secret life because he’s ashamed!

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Hey, Leonard, can I talk to you for a sec?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, but let’s go out here where there’s a little less yelling and guilt. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I got you a little going away present.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, a blanket.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, not just a blanket. See, it has sleeves. Yeah! So, you can, you know, be all snoodled up while you do your science stuff.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, wow, cool.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I’m gonna miss you. See you later.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: I told you no. Why don’t you believe me?

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother
utterance.content: ‘Cause it doesn’t make sense to me! How can it be that in the entire country of India, there isn’t one Outback Steakhouse?!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want a cookie, Meemaw.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But Meemaw just made cookies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, I don’t know if I can go on the expedition.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think I can go to the North Pole.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, Leonard, I know you’re concerned about disappointing me but I want you to take comfort from the knowledge that my expectations of you are very low.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s very comforting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Comforting is a part of leadership. It’s not a part I care for, but such is my burden.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Terrific, it’s just that I don’t think Penny wants me to go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Assuming that’s a valid reason not to go, which it isn’t, how do you know this? Did she say it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not exactly. But she said she was gonna miss me and she gave me this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a blanket with sleeves.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s clever. Let me see if I understand this correctly. Her missing you is an emotional state you find desirable?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, obviously.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Well, given that missing you is predicated on you leaving, logic dictates you must leave.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, okay, but I’m gonna be gone for three months. What if she doesn’t miss me that long and she meets someone else?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She does have a short attention span.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, I can’t go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you may be right. It appears that Penny secretly wants you in her life in a very intimate and carnal fashion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You really think so?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course not. Even in my sleep-deprived state, I’ve managed to pull off another one of my classic pranks. Bazinga!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard, what time is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s 7 a.m. I’m sorry it’s early, but we’re leaving soon, and I needed to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did you mean when you said you’re going to miss me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I don’t know. You’ll be gone and I’ll notice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (indicating the blanket)
utterance.content: Okay, well, um, what about this? What does this mean?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wine, credit card and late night television are a bad combination.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, fine. What about that really long hug? What did that mean?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That wasn’t a long hug.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was at least five Mississippis. A standard hug is two Mississippis tops.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, I don’t know what to tell you. It was just a hug.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Glad we cleared that up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I guess I’ll see you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, have a safe trip.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, bye. Means I wish you weren’t going.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re out of ice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, men, we begin initial assembly and deployment of the testing equipment starting tomorrow at 0700 hours, but until then, you are all off duty. I suggest you keep the shenanigans to a minimum as medical help is 18 hours away by dogsled.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you working on?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Crossbow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, guys, can I just say something? How about we take a moment to think about where we are right now? This is literally the top of the world. Only a handful of people in all of human history will ever see what we are going to see.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is remarkable.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, who’s up for a movie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good idea, what do you think? Ice Station Zebra or John Carpenter’s The Thing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I say double feature.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Dinner’s ready!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are we having?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Reconstituted Thai food.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you bring the dehydrated low-sodium soy sauce?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Freeze-dried spicy mustard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Check.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Flash-frozen brown rice, not white?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not to worry. I hid it. Bazinga! You’re in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There’s no time for a crossbow. Find me an icicle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Three months. This is gonna be great!
